entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:22AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Rivers Through the Weekend... Numerous rain showers through Saturday will cause rises in creeks and rivers in the Western and Central Brooks Range through the weekend. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the Western and Central Brooks range through Saturday. People in the Western and Central Brooks range and along
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 04 at 12:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near Record Warm Temperatures Could Bring High River Levels... A heat wave arrives later this week causing temperatures to soar into the upper 70s and 80s. Warmest temperatures are expected Friday and Saturday. With these warm temperatures, increased snowmelt at elevation will increase runoff into the Chilkat River Basin. Confidence is increasing that the Chilkat River could reach minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 12:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heat Wave Arrives This Week... High potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:08AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: The combination of light winds, abundant low-level moisture, and trapped smoke from fireworks last night has led to areas of fog this morning. Conditions are expected to quickly improve over the next hour or two with sunrise and the onset of daytime heating. Be alert to rapidly changing visibilities this morning and allow a safe distance between vehicles.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:08AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: The combination of light winds, abundant low-level moisture, and trapped smoke from fireworks last night has led to areas of fog this morning. Conditions are expected to quickly improve over the next hour or two with sunrise and the onset of daytime heating. Be alert to rapidly changing visibilities this morning and allow a safe distance between vehicles.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk
